Author: zawy#5864
Content: This EMA is special

Author: zawy#5864
Content: It's because it's a rolling average in disguise

Author: zawy#5864
Content: rolling averages make sure the window did not release too many blocks.  EMA is a moving average that gives expontially more weight to the most recent blocks.  Careful math shows how this results in only needing to adjust based on the current block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: amazing

Author: zawy#5864
Content: The memory of the current adjustment lingers in future adjustments because if it was made higher, each of the next few blocks will be higher penalizing the later blocks for what was lost in previous blocks.....but the penalty exponentially decreases, so the big miner staying on a few blocks gets most of the penalty himself

Content: After the fact, I found out this specific form was in wikipedia, almost like an interesting after thought applied to electronic equipment production.  Jacob was trying to derive something frmo wikipedia and his intuition, but I don't think he ever realized he had come up with what they showed about 2 sections after he stopped reading.  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving_average#Application_to_measuring_computer_performance
